title: Unravelling the role of pore structure of biomass-derived porous carbon in charge storage mechanisms for supercapacitors
content:
RSC Adv., 2024, 14,24631-24642
DOI: 10.1039/D4RA04681A, Paper
Open Access
  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 3.0 Unported Licence.
Mostafa S. Sayed, Delvin Aman, Moataz G. Fayed, Mostafa M. Omran, Tamer Zaki, Saad G. Mohamed
Coconut shells were used to produce activated carbons (AC), boasting extensive surface areas and enriched meso–micro-porous architectures. The derived-AC electrodes demonstrated outstanding symmetric EDLCs in both aqueous and organic electrolytes.
